divs: Sighting DetailsMy friend and I were both very tired driving back from a concert in Denver to Greeley. She was driving North on I-25 and I was in the passenger seat. When we saw the object, we were between Longmont and Loveland. I noticed the object at about midnight because of its brightness, it was on my side of vision, on the east side of the highway. It was very fast and low on the horizon and had a bright green trail with an orange center. The trail was about a mile wide and a couple of miles long. I lost sight of the object when it appeared to crash. My first reaction was shock and I shouted an expletive. The object caught my friend's eye out of her peripheral vision and she was surprised as well I checked to see what time it was to see if there was any substantial time loss, but I couldn't really tell if there was any since I was unsure of the exact time of the event. It was very unusual and unlike any meteor I've seen while viewing meteor showers. I thought it was either space junk or a UFO because the trail was thicker and it was lower than a normal meteorite. My friend and I both believe that it seemed out of the ordinary. I was slightly scared, but more excited. Now I fear that if an object did crash it has already been recovered.
Summary: Fireball with bright green trail, about a mile wide, appeared to crash
